answer_found_by_llm: The attacker gained access to the system through successful SSH logins using the 'sshd' service. Multiple user accounts, including 'root', were accessed from various external IP addresses.
The targeted system is running Kali GNU/Linux version 2024.1.
The compromised account is the 'root' account.
The number of distinct attackers who gained access to the system is 69.
The number of requests sent to the Apache server is 365.
No, I can not identify any scanning tool downloaded files in the target system.
There were no successful logins from the IP address 219.150.161.20.
The new accounts created on the system are: user4, user1, user2, sshd, Debian-exim, mysql, packet, dhg, messagebus, fido, and wind3str0y.
The proxy used in the system is a SOCKS4 proxy configured to run on localhost (127.0.0.1) at port 9050, utilizing Tor.
